artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Kakumotoya Kinjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 20; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 6–7 no. 3, p. 299.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: unattached triptych; two male figures charge toward a monster in the sky at L; both are holding swords, and figure at far R holds a lantern which illuminates a monster against the black night sky; monsters in shadow faintly visible in sky
markings: Artist’s seal R: 玉桜 {Gyokuō} | Censor seal: 申四改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 一魁斎芳年画 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi ga}
text: Chikudōmaru 竹童丸 (R), Kusunoki Tamonmaru Masatsura 楠多門丸正行 (L).
title: Picture of Kusunoki Tamonmaru Conquering the Old Badger
